section.para: selma'ocross-reference list ofselma'o catalog The following paragraphs list all the selma'o of Lojban, with a brief explanation of what each one is about, and reference to the chapter number where each is explained more fully. As usual, all selma'o names are given in capital letters (with “h” serving as the capital of “'”) and are the names of a representative cmavo, often the most important or the first in alphabetical order. One example is given of each selma'o: for selma'o which have several uses, the most common use is shown.
section.bridgehead: Aselma'o catalog connectionof sumtiselma'o catalog selma'o A ()
section.para: Specifies a logical connection (e.g. “and”, “or”, “if”), usually between sumti.
section.programlisting: la djan. .a la djein. klama le zarci John and/or Jane goes to the store.
section.para: Also used to create vowel lerfu words when followed with “bu”.
section.bridgehead: BAIselma'o catalog sumti placeadditionalselma'o catalog selma'o BAI ()
section.para: May be prefixed to a sumti to specify an additional place, not otherwise present in the place structure of the selbri, and derived from a single place of some other selbri.
section.programlisting: mi tavla bau la lojban. I speak in-language Lojban.
section.bridgehead: BAhEselma'o catalog nonce wordmarkingselma'o catalog emphasismarkingselma'o catalog selma'o BAhE ()
section.para: Emphasizes the next single word, or marks it as a nonce word (one invented for the occasion).
section.programlisting: la ba'e .djordj. klama le zarci George goes to the store. It is George who goes to the store.
section.para: Attaches sumti which fill the place structure of a single unit making up a tanru. Unless otherwise indicated, the sumti fill the x2, x3, and successive places in that order. is most useful in descriptions formed with . See , .
section.programlisting: mi klama be ta troci I am-a-(goer to-that) type-of-trier. I try to go to that place.
section.para: Separates multiple sumti attached by to a tanru unit.
section.programlisting: mi klama be le zarci bei le zdani be'o troci I am-a-(goer to-the store from-the home) type-of-trier. I try to go from the home to the market.
section.para: Elidable terminator for . Terminates sumti that are attached to a tanru unit.
section.programlisting: mi klama be le zarci be'o troci I am-a-(goer to-the market) type-of-trier. I try to go to the market.
section.para: Prefixed to a mathematical operator to mark it as higher priority than other mathematical operators, binding its operands more closely.
section.programlisting: li ci bi'e pi'u vo su'i mu du li paze The-number 3 [priority] times 4 plus 5 equals the-number 17. 3 × 4 + 5 = 17
section.para: Joins sumti or tanru units (as well as some other things) to form intervals. See .
section.programlisting: mi ca sanli la drezdn. bi'i la frankfurt. I [present] stand-on-surface Dresden [interval] Frankfurt. I am standing between Dresden and Frankfurt.
section.para: Joins tanru units, binding them together closely. Also used to bind logically or non-logically connected phrases, sentences, etc. is always high precedence and right-grouping.
section.programlisting: ta cmalu nixli bo ckule That is-a-small type-of (girl type-of school). That is a small school for girls.
section.para: Elidable terminator for or . Used to terminate a number (string of numeric cmavo) or lerfu string (string of letter words) when another string immediately follows.
section.programlisting: li re du li vu'u voboi re The-number two equals the-number the-difference-of four-and two.
section.para: A suffix which can be attached to any word, typically a word representing a letter of the alphabet or else a name, to make a word for a symbol or a different letter of the alphabet. In particular, attached to single-vowel cmavo to make words for vowel letters.
section.programlisting: .abu .ebu .ibu .obu .ubu .ybu a, e, i, o, u, y.
section.para: Words representing the letters of the Lojban alphabet, plus various shift words which alter the interpretation of other letter words. Terminated by BOI.
section.programlisting: .abu tavla .by le la .ibymym. skami A talks-to B about-the of-IBM computers. A talks to B about IBM computers.
section.para: Indicates the intensity of an emotion: maximum, strong, weak, or not at all. Typically follows another particle which specifies the emotion.
section.programlisting: .ei cai mi klama le zarci [Obligation!] [Intense!] I go-to the market. I must go to the market.
section.para: Specifies whether a bridi refers to an actual fact, a potential (achieved or not), or merely an innate capability.
section.programlisting: ro datka ka'e flulimna All ducks [capability] are-float-swimmers. All ducks have the capability of swimming by floating.
section.para: Assigns a selbri definition to one of the five pro-bridi gismu: “broda”, “brode”, “brodi”, “brodo”, or “brodu”, for later use.
section.programlisting: ti slasi je mlatu bo cidja lante gacri cei broda .i le crino broda cu barda .i le xunre broda cu cmalu This is a plastic cat-food can cover, or thingy. The green thingy is large. The red thingy is small.
section.para: Joins multiple terms into a termset. Termsets are used to associate several terms for logical connectives, for equal quantifier scope, or for special constructs in tenses.
section.programlisting: mi ce'e do pe'e je la djan. ce'e la djeimyz. cu pendo I [,] you [joint] and John [,] James are-friends-of. I am a friend of you, and John is a friend of James.
section.para: When inserted between the components of a tanru, inverts it, so that the following tanru unit modifies the previous one.
section.programlisting: mi troci co klama le zarci le zdani I am-a-trier of-type (goer to-the market from-the house). I try to go to the market from the house.
section.para: When prefixed to a name, description, or sumti, produces a vocative: a phrase which indicates who is being spoken to (or who is speaking). Vocatives are used in conversational protocols, including greeting, farewell, and radio communication. Terminated by . See .
section.programlisting: coi .djan. Greetings, John.
section.para: Separates the selbri of a bridi from any sumti which precede it. Never strictly necessary, but often useful to eliminate various elidable terminators.
section.programlisting: le gerku cu klama le zarci The dog goes to-the store.
section.para: Forms a question which asks when, where, or in what mode the rest of the bridi is true. See , , , and .
section.programlisting: do cu'e klama le zarci You [When/Where?] go to-the store? When are you going to the store?
section.para: The non-specific vocative indicator. May be used with or without . No pause is required between “doi” and a following name. See .
section.programlisting: doi frank. mi tavla do O Frank, I speak-to you. Frank, I'm talking to you.
section.para: Elidable terminator for or . Signals the end of a vocative.
section.programlisting: coi do'u Greetings [terminator] Greetings, O unspecified one!
section.para: Prefix for a sumti, indicating which numbered place in the place structure the sumti belongs in; overrides word order.
section.programlisting: fa mi cu klama fi la .atlantas. fe la bastn. fo le dargu fu le karce x1= I go x3= Atlanta x2= Boston x4= the road x5= the car. I go from Atlanta to Boston via the road using the car.
le nanmu zu'a batci le gerku The man [left] bites the dog. To my left, the man bites the dog.
section.para: A mechanical signal, outside the grammar, indicating that there is no more text. Useful in talking to computers.
Indicates that the following interval modifier (using , , or ) refers to space rather than time.
section.programlisting: ko vi'i fe'e di'i sombo le gurni You-imperative [1-dimensional] [space] [regularly] sow the grain. Sow the grain in a line and evenly!
section.para: Elidable terminator for . Indicates the end of an ad hoc modal tag: the tagged sumti immediately follows.
section.programlisting: mi viska do fi'o kanla [fe'u] le zunle I see you [modal] eye: the left-thing I see you with the left eye.
section.para: When placed before a selbri, transforms the selbri into a modal tag, grammatically and semantically equivalent to a member of selma'o . Terminated by .
section.programlisting: mi viska do fi'o kanla le zunle I see you with eye the left-thing I see you with my left eye.
section.para: Signals the end of a compound alphabet letter word that begins with . Not an elidable terminator.
section.programlisting: tei .ebu .akut. bu foi ( “e” “acute” ) the letter “e” with an acute accent
section.para: Indicates that the following mathematical expression is to be interpreted as reverse Polish (RP), a mode in which mathematical operators follow their operands.
section.programlisting: li fu'a reboi re[boi] su'i du li vo the-number [RP!] two, two, plus equals the-number four 2 + 2 = 4
section.para: Indicates that the following indicator(s) of selma'o affect not the preceding word, as usual, but rather all following words until a .
section.programlisting: mi viska le fu'e .ia blanu zdani fu'o ponse I see the [start] [belief] blue house [end] possessor I see the owner of a blue house, or what I believe to be one.
section.para: Cancels all indicators of selma'o which are in effect.
section.programlisting: mi viska le fu'e .ia blanu zdani fu'o ponse I see the [start] [belief] blue house [end] possessor. I see the owner of what I believe to be a blue house.
section.para: Indicates the beginning of two logically connected sumti, bridi-tails, or various other things. Logical connections include “both ... and”, “either ... or”, “if ... then”, and so on. See .
section.programlisting: ga la djan. nanmu gi la djeimyz. ninmu Either John is a man or James is a woman (or both).
section.para: Specifies whether an interval specified by includes or excludes its endpoints. Used in pairs before and after the cmavo, to specify the nature of both the left- and the right-hand endpoints.
section.programlisting: mi ca sanli la drezdn. ga'o bi'i ga'o la frankfurt. I [present] stand Dresden [inclusive] [interval] [inclusive] Frankfurt. I am standing between Dresden and Frankfurt, inclusive of both.
section.para: Elidable terminator for . Marks the end of a relative phrase. See .
section.programlisting: la djan. goi ko'a ge'u blanu John (referred to as it-1) is-blue.
section.para: Separates two logically or non-logically connected sumti, tanru units, bridi-tails, or other things, when the prefix is a forethought connective involving , , or .
section.programlisting: ge la djan. nanmu gi la djeimyz. ninmu (It is true that) both John is a man and James is a woman.
section.para: Specifies a logical connective (e.g. “and”, “or”, “if”) between two bridi-tails: a bridi-tail is a selbri with any associated following sumti, but not including any preceding sumti.
section.programlisting: mi klama le zarci gi'e nelci la djan. I go-to the market and like John.
section.para: Specifies the beginning of a relative phrase, which associates a subordinate sumti (following) to another sumti (preceding). Terminated by See .
section.programlisting: la djan. goi ko'a cu blanu John (referred to as it-1) is blue.
section.para: A general selma'o for all cmavo which can take the place of brivla. There are several groups of these.
section.programlisting: A: mi klama le zarci B: mi go'i A: I'm going to the market. B: Me, too.
section.para: Indicates the beginning of two logically connected tanru units. Takes the place of when forming logically-connected tanru. See .
section.programlisting: la .alis. gu'e ricfu gi blanu Alice is both rich and blue.
section.para: Separates two sentences from each other.
section.programlisting: mi klama le zarci .i mi klama le zdani I go-to the market. I go-to the office.
section.para: Specifies a logical connection (e.g. “and”, “or”, “if”) between two tanru units, mathematical operands, tenses, or abstractions.
section.programlisting: ti blanu je zdani This is-blue and a-house.
section.para: When followed by a tense or modal, creates a conversion operator attachable to a selbri which exchanges the modal place with the x1 place of the selbri. When alone, is a conversion operator exchanging the x1 place of the selbri (which should be an abstract sumti) with one of the places of the abstracted-over bridi.
section.programlisting: mi jai gau galfi le bitmu skari I am-the-actor-in modifying the wall color. I act so as to modify the wall color. I change the color of the wall.
section.para: Specifies a non-logical connection (e.g. together-with-as-mass, -set, or -sequence) between two sumti, tanru units, or various other things. When immediately followed by , provides forethought non-logical connection analogous to .
section.programlisting: la djan. joi la .alis. cu bevri le pipno John massed-with Alice carry the piano.
section.para: Indicates that the following mathematical operands (a list terminated by ) form a mathematical vector (one-dimensional array).
section.programlisting: li jo'i paboi reboi te'u su'i jo'i ciboi voboi du li jo'i voboi xaboi The-number array( one, two ) plus array( three, four) equals the-number array (four, six). (1,2) + (3,4) = (4,6)
section.para: Groups everything between itself and a following for purposes of logical connection, tanru construction, or other purposes. and are not used for mathematical (see and ) or discursive (see and ) purposes.
section.programlisting: ta ke melbi cmalu ke'e nixli ckule That is-a-( pretty little ) girl school. That is a school for girls who are pretty in their littleness.
section.para: Elidable terminator for . Marks the end of an abstraction bridi.
section.programlisting: la djan. cu nu sonci kei djica John is-an-(event-of being-a-soldier) type-of desirer. John wants to be a soldier.
section.para: Elidable terminator for . Marks the end of a grouping.
section.programlisting: ta ke melbi cmalu ke'e nixli ckule That is-a-( pretty little ) girl school. That is a school for girls who are pretty in their littleness.
section.para: When preceded by a tense or modal, makes it “sticky”, so that it applies to all further bridi until reset by another appearance of . When alone, eliminates all sticky tenses.
A general selma'o which contains all cmavo which can substitute for sumti. These cmavo are divided into several groups.
section.programlisting: le blanu zdani goi ko'a cu barda .i ko'a na cmamau ti The blue house (referred to as it-1) is big. It-1 is-not smaller-than this-thing.
section.para: Elidable terminator for and some uses of . Indicates the end of a description sumti. Also used after a tense or modal to indicate that no sumti follows, and in the compound + to indicate natural language-style negation.
section.programlisting: le prenu ku le zdani ku klama The person, to-the house, goes. The person goes to the house.
section.para: Elidable terminator for : indicates the end of a forethought mathematical expression (one in which the operator precedes the operands).
section.programlisting: li pe'o su'i reboi reboi re[boi] ku'e du li xa The number [forethought] the-sum-of two two two [end] equals the-number six.
section.para: Elidable terminator for . Indicates the end of a relative clause.
section.programlisting: le zdani poi blanu ku'o barda The house which is-blue is-big.
section.para: Descriptors which change name words (or selbri) into sumti which identify people or things by name. Similar to . May be terminated with if followed by a description selbri.
section.programlisting: la kikeros. du la tulis. Cicero is Tully.
section.para: Combines with the following alphabetic letter to represent a single marker: change from lower to upper case, change of font, punctuation, etc.)
section.programlisting: tau sy. .ibu [single-shift] “s” “i” Si (chemical symbol for silicon)
section.para: Qualifiers which, when prefixed to a sumti, change it into another sumti with related meaning. Qualifiers can also consist of a cmavo from selma'o plus . Terminated by .
section.programlisting: mi viska la'e zoi kuot. A Tale of Two Cities .kuot I see that-represented-by the-text “A Tale of Two Cities”. I see the book “A Tale of Two Cities”.
section.para: Descriptors which make selbri into sumti which describe or specify things that fit into the x1 place of the selbri. Terminated by . See .
section.programlisting: le gerku cu klama le zdani The dog goes-to the house.
section.para: Indicates the end of a quotation begun with . Not an elidable terminator.
section.programlisting: lo'u mi du do du mi le'u cu na lojbo drani [quote] mi du do du mi [unquote] is-not Lojbanically correct. “mi du do du mi” is not correct Lojban.
section.para: Descriptors which change numbers or other mathematical expressions into sumti which specify numbers or numerical expressions. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: li re su'u re na du li vo su'i vo The-number 2 minus 2 not equals the-number 4 plus 4. 2 - 2 ≠ 4 + 4
section.para: Elidable terminator for . Indicates the end of a text quotation.
section.programlisting: mi cusku lu mi klama le zarci li'u I express [quote] I go-to the market [end quote].
section.para: Elidable terminator for . Indicates the end of a mathematical expression used in a description.
section.programlisting: li vo lo'o li ci lo'o cu zmadu The-number 4 [end number], the number 3 [end number], is greater. 4 > 3
section.para: Indicates the beginning of a quotation (a sumti) which is grammatical as long as the quoted material consists of Lojban words, whether they form a text or not. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: do cusku lo'u mi du do du ko'a le'u You express [quote] mi du do du ko'a [end quote]. You said, “mi du do du ko'a”.
section.para: Indicates the beginning of a quotation (a sumti) which is grammatical only if the quoted material also forms a grammatical Lojban text. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: mi cusku lu mi klama le zarci li'u I express [quote] I go-to the market [end quote].
section.para: Elidable terminator for and + . Indicates the end of a qualified sumti.
section.programlisting: mi viska la'e lu barda gerku li'u lu'u I see the-referent-of [quote] big dog [end quote] [end ref] I saw “Big Dog” [not the words, but a book or movie].
section.para: When suffixed to a number or string of letter words, produces a free modifier which serves as an index number within a text.
section.programlisting: pamai mi pu klama le zarci 1-thly, I [past] go to-the market. First, I went to the market.
section.para: Produces a mathematical operator from a letter or other operand. Terminated by . See .
section.programlisting: ma'o fy. boi xy. [operator] f x f(x)
section.para: Produces a tanru unit from a sumti, which is applicable to the things referenced by the sumti. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: ta me la ford. karce That is-a-Ford-type car That's a Ford car.
section.para: The elidable terminator for . Indicates the end of a sumti converted to a tanru unit.
section.programlisting: ta me mi me'u zdani That's a me type of house.
section.para: Suffixes added to numbers or other quantifiers to make various numerically-based selbri.
section.programlisting: la djan. joi la frank. cu bruna remei John in-a-mass-with Frank are-a-brother-type-of twosome. John and Frank are two brothers.
section.para: Produces a mathematical operand from a sumti; used to make dimensioned units. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: li mo'e re ratcu su'i mo'e re ractu du li mo'e vo danlu The-number two rats plus two rabbits equals the-number four animals. 2 rats + 2 rabbits = 4 animals.
section.para: A tense flag indicating movement in space, in a direction specified by a following cmavo.
section.programlisting: le verba mo'i ri'u cadzu le bisli The child [movement] [right] walks-on the ice. The child walks toward my right on the ice.
section.para: Contradictory negators, asserting that a whole bridi is false (or true).
section.programlisting: mi na klama le zarci It is not true that I go to the market.
section.para: Also used to construct logical connective compound cmavo.
Negates the previous word, but can only be used with certain selma'o as specified by the grammar.
Scalar negators, modifying a selbri or a sumti to a value other than the one stated, the opposite of the one stated, etc. Also used with following to construct a sumti qualifier; see .
section.programlisting: ta na'e blanu zdani That is-a-non- blue house. That is a house which is other than blue.
section.para: Creates a mathematical operator from a selbri. Terminated by . See .
section.programlisting: li na'u tanjo te'u vei pai fe'i re [ve'o] du li ci'i The-number the-operator tangent ( π / 2 ) = the-number infinity. tan( π/2) = ∞
section.para: Creates a mathematical operand from a selbri, usually a “ni” abstraction. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: li ni'e ni clani [te'u] pi'i ni'e ni ganra [te'u] pi'i ni'e ni condi te'u du li ni'e ni canlu The-number quantity-of length times quantity-of width times quantity-of depth equals the-number quantity-of volume. Length × Width × Depth = Volume
section.para: Marks the beginning of a new paragraph, and indicates whether it contains old or new subject matter.
Introduces relative clauses. The following bridi modifies the preceding sumti. Terminated by . See .
section.programlisting: le zdani poi blanu cu cmalu The house which is blue is small.
section.para: Abstractors which, when prefixed to a bridi, create abstraction selbri. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: la djan. cu djica le nu sonci [kei] John desires the event-of being-a-soldier.
section.para: Creates a selbri from a mathematical operator. See .
section.programlisting: li ni'umu cu nu'a va'a li ma'umu The-number -5 is-the-negation-of the-number +5
section.para: Marks the beginning of a termset, which is used to make simultaneous claims involving two or more different places of a selbri. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: mi klama nu'i ge le zarci le briju nu'u gi le zdani le ckule [nu'u] I go [start] to-the market from-the office [joint] and to-the house from-the school.
section.para: Elidable terminator for . Marks the end of a termset.
section.programlisting: mi klama nu'i ge le zarci le briju nu'u gi le zdani le ckule [nu'u] I go [start] to-the market from-the office [joint] and to-the house from-the school.
section.para: Digits and related quantifiers (some, all, many, etc.). Terminated by .
section.programlisting: mi speni re ninmu I am-married-to two women.
section.para: Precedes a logical or non-logical connective that joins two termsets. Termsets (see ) are used to associate several terms for logical connectives, for equal quantifier scope, or for special constructs in tenses.
section.programlisting: mi ce'e do pe'e je la djan. ce'e la djeimyz. cu pendo I [,] you [joint] and John [,] James are-friends-of. I am a friend of you, and John is a friend of James.
section.para: An optional signal of forethought mathematical operators, which precede their operands. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: li vo du li pe'o su'i reboi re The-number four equals the-number [forethought] sum-of two two.
section.para: Specifies simple time directions (future, past, or neither).
section.programlisting: mi pu klama le zarci I [past] go-to the market. I went to the market.
section.para: The pro-bridi update flag: changes the meaning of sumti implicitly attached to a pro-bridi (see ) to fit the current context rather than the original context.
section.programlisting: A: mi ba lumci le mi karce B: mi go'i A: I [future] wash my car. B: I do-the-same-thing (i.e. wash A's car). A: mi ba lumci le mi karce B: mi go'i ra'o A: I [future] wash my car. B: I do-the-corresponding-thing (i.e. wash B's car).
section.para: When suffixed to a number, makes an extensional tense (e.g. once, twice, many times).
section.programlisting: mi reroi klama le zarci I twice go-to the market.
section.para: Erases the previous phrase or sentence.
section.programlisting: mi klama sa do klama le zarci I go, er, you go-to the market.
section.para: Converts a selbri, rearranging the order of places by exchanging the x1 place with a specified numbered place.
section.programlisting: le zarci cu se klama mi The market is-gone-to by me.
section.para: Also used in constructing connective and modal compound cmavo.
Marks the beginning of metalinguistic insertions which comment on the main bridi. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: la frank. prami sei gleki [se'u] la djein. Frank loves (he is happy) Jane.
section.para: Elidable terminator for and . Ends metalinguistic insertions.
section.programlisting: la frank. prami sei gleki se'u la djein. Frank loves (he is happy) Jane.
section.para: Erases the previous single word.
section.programlisting: mi si do klama le zarci I, er, you go to-the market.
section.para: Marks reciprocity between two sumti (like “vice versa” in English).
section.programlisting: mi prami do soi mi I love you [reciprocally] me. I love you and vice versa.
section.para: Closes and erases the entire previous discourse.
A tense modifier specifying frequencies within an interval of time or space (regularly, habitually, etc.).
section.programlisting: le verba ta'e klama le ckule The child habitually goes to-the school.
section.para: Signals the beginning of a compound letter word, which acts grammatically like a single letter. Compound letter words end with the non-elidable selma'o .
section.programlisting: tei .ebu .akut. bu foi ( “e” “acute” ) the letter “e” with an acute accent
section.para: Elidable terminator for , , , , or . Marks the end of a mathematical conversion construct.
section.programlisting: li jo'i paboi reboi te'u su'i jo'i ciboi voboi du li jo'i voboi xaboi The-number array (one, two) plus array (three, four) equals the-number array( four, six). (1,2) + (3,4) = (4,6)
section.para: Left discursive parenthesis: allows inserting a digression. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: doi lisas. mi djica le nu to doi frank. ko sisti toi do viska le mlatu O Lisa, I desire the event-of ( O Frank, [imperative] stop! ) you see the cat. Lisa, I want you to (Frank! Stop!) see the cat.
section.para: Elidable terminator for . The right discursive parenthesis.
section.programlisting: doi lisas. mi djica le nu to doi frank. ko sisti toi do viska le mlatu O Lisa, I desire the event-of ( O Frank, [imperative] stop! ) you see the cat. Lisa, I want you to (Frank! Stop!) see the cat.
section.para: Groups multiple sentences or paragraphs into a logical unit. Terminated by .
section.programlisting: lo xagmau zo'u tu'e ganai cidja gi citno .i ganai vanju gi tolci'o [tu'u] Is-best : [start] If food, then new. If wine, then old. As for what is best: if food, then new [is best]; if wine, then old [is best].
section.para: Elidable terminator for . Marks the end of a multiple sentence group.
Particles which indicate the speaker's emotional state or source of knowledge, or the present stage of discourse.
section.programlisting: .ui la djan. klama [Happiness!] John is-coming. Hurrah! John is coming!
section.para: A tense indicating distance in space (near, far, or neither).
section.programlisting: le nanmu va batci le gerku The man [medium distance] bites the dog. Over there the man is biting the dog.
section.para: Elidable terminator for a simple bridi, or for each bridi-tail of a logical connection.

section.para: Attaches relative clauses or phrases to a whole (possibly connected) sumti, rather than simply to the leftmost portion of the sumti.

section.para: Hesitation noise: content-free, but holds the floor or continues the conversation. It is different from silence in that silence may be interpreted as having nothing more to say.

section.para: A tense modifier specifying the contour of an event (e.g. beginning, ending, continuing).

section.para: A morphological glue word, which joins the two words it stands between into the equivalent of a lujvo.
section.programlisting: ta xy. zei kantu kacma That is-an-(X – ray) camera. That is an X-ray camera.

section.para: A tense indicating distance in time (a long, medium or short time ago or in the future).
section.programlisting: mi puzi citka I [past] [short distance] eat. I ate a little while ago.
section.para: Joins multiple relative phrases or clauses which apply to the same sumti. Although generally translated with “and”, it is not considered a logical connective.
section.programlisting: mi ponse pa gerku ku poi blabi zi'e noi mi prami ke'a I own one dog such-that it-is-white and such-that-incidentally I love it. I own a dog that is white and which, incidentally, I love. I own a white dog, which I love.
section.para: Single-word quotation: quotes the following single Lojban word.
section.programlisting: zo si cu lojbo valsi The-word “si” is-a-Lojbanic word.
section.para: Non-Lojban quotation: quotes any text using a delimiting word (which can be any single Lojban word) placed before and after the text. The delimiting word must not appear in the text, and must be separated from the text by pauses.
section.programlisting: zoi kuot. Socrates is mortal .kuot. cu glico jufra The-text “Socrates is mortal” is-an-English sentence.
section.para: Separates a logical prenex from a bridi or group of sentences to which it applies. Also separates a topic from a comment in topic/comment sentences.
